conclusion: During 0 – 1 s the velocity is constant at +2 m s⁻¹
From 1 s to 3 s the velocity decreases linearly from +2 m s⁻¹ to –2 m s⁻¹
The linear decrease in velocity from 1 s to 3 s indicates a non-zero (constant) acceleration
Because the velocity is not the same throughout the entire 0 – 3 s interval, the particle’s motion is variable
The particle’s speed and direction both change, confirming variable motion
